meanings.definition: To fasten or secure a button again.
meanings.sent1: She had to rebutton her coat after it came undone.
meanings.sent2: I need to rebutton my shirt before going out.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rebutton his pants, but they were too tight!
meanings.sent4: The detective had to rebutton the evidence together to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The tailor skillfully rebuttoned the torn jacket.

meanings.definition: To attach a button to something again.
meanings.sent1: She had to rebutton her teddy bear's eye that fell off.
meanings.sent2: I will rebutton the missing button on my backpack.
meanings.sent3: The child happily rebuttoned the button on his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: She carefully rebuttoned the button on her bracelet, making it look new.
meanings.sent5: The seamstress expertly rebuttoned the loose button on the dress.
